Official Website: http://squidsoft.net
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Humanity has just emerged from the lowest point in its collective history, and
the closest it has been to extinction since the advent of agriculture. By the
year 2304, the Coalition of humans and their alien allies the Jinu has spread
across the stars, and thought themselves powerful. But the Outsiders, an alien
empire occupying vast reaches of Rimward space, proved them wrong. First contact
between the two allies was severed, and suddenly humanity was alone. Then the
Outsiders attacked in force, and human planets and governments fell one by one.
                         It was the apocalypse.
But contrary to the beliefs of many, not all hope was lost. After five years,
a single starship, the Percival Lowell, returned from Rimward space, bringing
with it the means to nullify the Outsiders' greatest weapon. With this, and the
help of many other brave pilots, the occupying Outsiders were driven off human
               worlds and back to where they came from.
 Humanity is now trying to rebuild, and trying to regain what it has lost. The
Outsiders are finished with occupation, and now desire only to see humans
extinct.
New threats and new mysteries seem to appear every day. In the midst of it all,
civilian starships span the stars, maintaining an open threat against any new
       invasion and trying to make a few credits while they're at it.
You too have felt the lure of this; the desire for a unique freedom that most
citizens will never know, the drive to explore, the need to defend your species,
         and yes, greed for the vast wealth that is to be had.
                   It is time to take to the stars.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Welcome to the original and still the most innovative pulp science fiction
multiplayer roleplaying adventure!
Originally opened in its classic form on 19 December 1998! Reopened in its new
iteration on 28 February 2009!
All original work (including setting, non-player characters, design, source
code, all related background material, and all text) located in this game or on
the Squidsoft.net website is copyright (c) Squidsoft.net 1998-2015. Unauthorised
reproduction prohibited.
Warning: Speech in this game is largely uncensored, and sensitive individuals
may find some other players offensive. The staff is ultimately not responsible
for the words and actions of the players.
The last server reset was at Sun Jul 10 23:23:34 2016 UTC
We're on Twitter! @StarConquest for server status notifications and out-of-game
contact!

    * Welcome to Star Conquest! *
[Starship "Shooting Star"; Control Capsule]
This small capsule is only large enough for one person. A single flight seat
molds itself to the form of its occupant, helping to ease the burden of
acceleration along with a rather underpowered artificial gravity dampening
system. The capsule's inner workings extend into the flight cabin, with the
starship's main computer right up against the back of the seat. A rather sparse
flight control board is presented claustrophobically close to the pilot's face.
It seems to lack any sort of manual control, allowing only automatic flight
profiles to be entered into an antiquated flight computer. It does, however,
possess controls to operate a single small turret. The status lights overhead
are currently not receiving power. Looking through the windows, you see that the
ship is in a garage. The hatch appears to be locked.
You see an improved temporary wormhole drive here.
You can go out.
(You are sitting.)

 Welcome back to Star Conquest!

 Star Conquest takes a lot of money to run. Please consider donating to offset
those costs.

 TIP: Salvaging, especially grappling debris chunks, is the fastest way to make
points.

launch
The navigation systems are nonfunctional until their power is restored.
power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Shooting Star, you are given launch
clearance under the AEU-League non-aggression pact."
ftl drifting
[AEU | 1: Alliance Communication] Lily Kaise transmits, "Hi Shule!"
A pair of odd-colored stars, one green and one blue, mark this curious area of
space. The sensors are picking up odd bits of noise that the ship's computer
insists on trying to convert to audio. Once in a while, something that could
almost sound like a word emerges from a burst of static.
The computer reports that in-sector beacons are transmitting the following:
1"UTN15_/GNt@S]n:KwZ94JY:tC@QX^HC@Z='C0g
This area of space is within the green belt of the nearest star, but there are
no life-bearing planets here. Instead there is merely an odd cluster of space
stations of unknown origin.
Via general sector communication, EAOS Asteroid Processor transmits, "Greetings,
Shooting Star! Welcome to The Drifting Cluster!"

[EAOS Asteroid Processor; Docking Bay]
The landing pad of this large round docking bay is lit by softly glowing lights
around its circumference. The entire bay is open to the stars, though the
atmosphere is somehow mysteriously contained.

[New Phoenix; Mexico Lane]
Though most cultures have blended over the years, old Mexican culture still
thrives here. Children from nearby apartment buildings play in small yards
ringed with chain link fencing. Faint phrases of the old language can barely be
made out as mothers converse with their children and neighbors. The scent of
Mexican food swims inside your nostrils from a small restaurant to the side of
the street.
You can go southeast and northwest.

[New Phoenix; Japan Boulevard]
Though not completely restored, the old office buildings along this part of
Japan Boulevard are already home to new businesses. Two new shops are directly
next to each other in the same building: 'Freneza,' which has in its front
windows displays of hosiery, belts, and odd-looking bracelets; and 'Studdedly,'
which occupies the corner of the building and advertises with hand-made signs
its low-priced stock of wrist bands and chokers. A number of glum and edgy
people seem to hang around these shops, their spiked hair and unique dress
setting them apart from the usual shoppers.
You can go east and west.
w
[New Phoenix; Japan Boulevard]
You can go east and west.
l
[New Phoenix; Japan Boulevard]
Ancient office buildings dominate this block. In their worn and dirty brick
facades and crumbling ornamental designs, many of them bear signs of having
fallen into disrepair. In spite of this, new business are moving in, including
an old but ornate building on the south side of the boulevard that is now
occupied by a clothing store called 'The Brink.' Darkly dressed but relatively
quiet individuals hang around the entrance.
You can go east and west.
w
[New Phoenix; Japan Boulevard]
You can go east and west.
l
[New Phoenix; Japan Boulevard]
Ancient office buildings dominate this block. The structures might be old, but
they have been recently renovated, and new business have recently moved in,
rejuvenating the entire area. On the south side of the street here, a new
furniture store displays beautiful arrangements of graceful rattan furniture
through its sparkling clean glass windows; over the entrance is the name
'Rattania' spelled out in burnished brass letters.
You can go east and west.
w
[New Phoenix; Japan Boulevard]
You can go east and west.
l
[New Phoenix; Japan Boulevard]
This block of Japan Boulevard has recently begun a commercial rejuvenation.
Where it was somewhat rundown before the war, the infusion of money from private
businesses has brought a new atmosphere of bustle and success to the area. On
the lower floor of a brick building on the northern side of the street, a
delightful-looking breakfast restaurant with a large plate glass window in the
front has just opened. 'Colt's Kitchen and Catering' is painted across the
window in cheerful red letters. The Boulevard continues both to the east and
west.
You can go east and west.
go kitchen
[New Phoenix; Colt's Kitchen]
You see a clean trash bin, a simple but eye-catching sign, and a deep green and
silver payphone here.
You can go out.

ftl accord
A handful of lonely beacons watch over this area of space, their lights glowing
palely in the dark, surrounded by tendrils of drifting dust and debris.
A planet once existed here, until it was destroyed by the Outsiders. Now only
large chunks of the planet remain, still drifting slowly away from each other,
with clouds of debris filling the sector.
A circular space station dominates this sector, made of darkened metal
reinforced against attack. By the look of it, this is probably the most heavily
armored station in human space, excepting The Torus. This is the heart of the
Accord of Free Worlds.

Tandem-EAOS Long-Range Hypercaster
--
Status:      Ready, currently operated by Starseekers
Power Level: 35% (best-case overall optimal maximum communication distance:
150.00 light-trade cycles)
Direction:   Galactic South and Very Slightly Down (270.0, -2.0)

take last letter from briefcase
You remove a letter from a leather briefcase.
read letter
--
Dear Kim, Shule, and Angel,
Anfisa, Nissi, Liam, Morris, and myself have headed off aboard Metal Heart to
rendezvous with Yadira Rivera, Keegan's tactical exploration platform. We are
performing the rendezvous for reasons that are very important to Anfisa and
Nissi. We will need some help from you to make sure that both ships can find
each other. 
Using course information that Yadira Rivera sent through the QE comm, we have
set our course to 75 2 from Coreward Reach. Please set the Torus hypercaster to
that heading. Use power setting 70%. I have asked Sakura, Zandria, and any other
Business Cats who are available to help with our slot from the 2300 to 2359
period, so between your rental time and ours we can achieve a two hour block of
broadcast time.
Since both Metal Heart and Yadira Rivera have QE comms, it is possible for
people here at home to relay a message from one ship to the other, either by
repeating the message over the hypercaster relay channel during the rental
times, or by sending a QE message from Accord of Free Worlds command station to
the intended ship. Since we'll be searching a fairly large area for the
rendezvous, any help you can provide in helping the two ships maintain
communication is very much appreciated.
Sincerely,
-Akemi Bando
--
use
Use what?

[1] View Hypercaster Information
[2] View Rental Schedule
[3] Cancel Hyperwave Relay Rental Plan
[4] Configure Hypercaster
Enter your selection:
4
You make a selection on a sleek Torus hyperwave relay interface.
[1] Adjust Power Level
[2] Change Direction
[3] Save Configuration
[4] Recall Configuration
Enter your selection:
The landing lights of the two-person medium transport "Registered Merchant 616"
briefly flash across the dome as the ship slowly approaches the station and
enters Dock Alpha.
2
Headings are in the format of: heading, elevation.
The heading itself is your broadcaster's orientation on its current plane, and
goes from 0 degrees (directly east), through 90 (north), 180 (west), and 270
(south) to 359 degrees.
Elevation is the degree to which your broadcasted signal is aimed up or down. It
goes from -90 degrees (straight down) to 0 degrees (remaining at the same
elevation) to 90 degrees (directly up).
75 2
You carefully turn a few small knobs on the broadcaster control board.
A number flap display rapidly flips around to indicate that the broadcaster is
now aimed at 75.0, 2.0.
read letter
--
Dear Kim, Shule, and Angel,
Anfisa, Nissi, Liam, Morris, and myself have headed off aboard Metal Heart to
rendezvous with Yadira Rivera, Keegan's tactical exploration platform. We are
performing the rendezvous for reasons that are very important to Anfisa and
Nissi. We will need some help from you to make sure that both ships can find
each other. 
Using course information that Yadira Rivera sent through the QE comm, we have
set our course to 75 2 from Coreward Reach. Please set the Torus hypercaster to
that heading. Use power setting 70%. I have asked Sakura, Zandria, and any other
Business Cats who are available to help with our slot from the 2300 to 2359
period, so between your rental time and ours we can achieve a two hour block of
broadcast time.
Since both Metal Heart and Yadira Rivera have QE comms, it is possible for
people here at home to relay a message from one ship to the other, either by
repeating the message over the hypercaster relay channel during the rental
times, or by sending a QE message from Accord of Free Worlds command station to
the intended ship. Since we'll be searching a fairly large area for the
rendezvous, any help you can provide in helping the two ships maintain
communication is very much appreciated.
Sincerely,
-Akemi Bando
--
use torus
You approach a sleek Torus hyperwave relay interface.
[1] View Hypercaster Information
[2] View Rental Schedule
[3] Cancel Hyperwave Relay Rental Plan
[4] Configure Hypercaster
Enter your selection:
4
You make a selection on a sleek Torus hyperwave relay interface.
[1] Adjust Power Level
[2] Change Direction
[3] Save Configuration
[4] Recall Configuration
Enter your selection:
1
Please input the broadcaster power, from 0 to 100%.
The higher the percentage, the greater the power level of the broadcaster, which
increases the range of the broadcast, but also makes the broadcast visible to a
much smaller angle.
70
You rapidly spin a prominent knob on the hypercaster control board, and the
needle on a backlit analogue needle display slowly rises from 35% to 70%.
read letter
--
Dear Kim, Shule, and Angel,
Anfisa, Nissi, Liam, Morris, and myself have headed off aboard Metal Heart to
rendezvous with Yadira Rivera, Keegan's tactical exploration platform. We are
performing the rendezvous for reasons that are very important to Anfisa and
Nissi. We will need some help from you to make sure that both ships can find
each other. 
Using course information that Yadira Rivera sent through the QE comm, we have
set our course to 75 2 from Coreward Reach. Please set the Torus hypercaster to
that heading. Use power setting 70%. I have asked Sakura, Zandria, and any other
Business Cats who are available to help with our slot from the 2300 to 2359
period, so between your rental time and ours we can achieve a two hour block of
broadcast time.
Since both Metal Heart and Yadira Rivera have QE comms, it is possible for
people here at home to relay a message from one ship to the other, either by
repeating the message over the hypercaster relay channel during the rental
times, or by sending a QE message from Accord of Free Worlds command station to
the intended ship. Since we'll be searching a fairly large area for the
rendezvous, any help you can provide in helping the two ships maintain
communication is very much appreciated.
Sincerely,
-Akemi Bando

ABILITIES
--
MINOR REPAIR
   Slightly repairs a single target.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 6 seconds
REGENERATE
   Repairs a single target over time. A slow but efficient repair.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 4 seconds
MINOR GROUP REPAIR
   Slightly repairs your entire squad.

   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 6 seconds

friendly minidrones in their work.

   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 12 seconds

   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 6 seconds

SONIC SLAM

   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 8 seconds
SONIC WAVE

   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     25                Time To Use: 10 seconds
SHAKE OFF
   Makes an enemy slightly more disinclined to hit you.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 4 seconds
GROUP PULSE

   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 8 seconds
CONFUSE

Destiny, be advised that the Free Port Doctrine is in effect here."

Accelerator to The Cross.
You feel the ship shudder slightly as it approaches a quantum skim accelerator.
The computer announces, "Initiating connection with The Cross's local quantum
skim accelerator network."
The computer announces, "Connection established. Communicating between quantum
skim acceleration gates now."
A Tardick lizard named Asteria curls its tail loosely around Lily Kaise's neck.
The computer announces, "Skim subroutine initializing in five seconds."
The computer announces, "Four."
The computer announces, "Three."
The computer announces, "Two."
The computer announces, "One."
The computer announces, "Skim subroutine initialized."
You feel the deck underneath you shudder violently, and you stumble slightly.

destination."

Galactic East."

Lily Kaise presses a button and brings up the FTL flight control board.

[Notification from Starseekers] The organization has received 4,274,374.23 EAOS
credits from a toll payment to League Rift Accelerating Battery-Powered Toll
Station in Home Beacon Gamma 001.
The computer announces, "Setting course to Outpost H-101. Local rift accelerator
with matching vector found."
Something deep inside the starship roars to life as the lights dim sharply.
A wormhole suddenly appears in front of the ship, its edges tinged an unusual
deep purple. Strange undulating shapes are half-visible deep inside it.
A thick undulating mist suddenly seems to rush toward the starship from every
direction, quickly blotting out the stars. Random shapes, some half-familiar,
occasionally form in the mist only to disappear almost immediately.
The computer beeps in an imperative manner and informs you that the starship's
sensors have detected a new location of interest in the riftflow.
Lily Kaise cuddles up to you.
You mentally sigh in relief as you return to the starship.

l lily 
Lily Kaise
She appears to be 27 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average breasts. Her
abdomen is attractive and punctuated by a cute navel. Her face is oval and
pretty, with a delicate nose and understated chin. Her lips are lovely and blush
pink and occasionally part to reveal a set of pretty teeth. Beneath a set of
arched eyebrows, her eyes are blue-green and almond-shaped. Her mid-back length,
straight hair is pale honey blonde and swept up into a thick fall of loose curls
down her back. She has oval pink fingernails.
A small enameled crimson dragon pierces her belly button, a small enameled
cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe, and a small enameled cerulean
blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.
 She is wearing a short red and white striped buttoned shirt, a pair of tight
faded purple denim jeans with a small dark-red 'XX' embroidered on the back left
pocket, and a pair of tan suede clogs. She is also wearing an orange and white
blessed prayer bracelet around her wrist, a slender bracelet of tiny tinkling
silver bells around her wrist, a neon purple wrist-mounted chronometer, a solid
silver ring engraved with dragonflies, a delicate ring of silver wire and small
purple amethyst crystals, a metallic gold touch einrophone in a metallic purple
reinforced plastic phone holster, a soft fuchsia Tardick lizard snuggly labeled
'Asteria', and a Tardick lizard named Asteria perched on her shoulder. Her head,
face, both eyes, neck, both elbows, abdomen, both forearms, both wrists, and
both hands are left uncovered.
She is carrying nothing.

West and Down. Sentry Rho 68

Rho 68.'"

You hear a single beep and glance up to see green lights flick on overhead as
the ship enters normal status.

powered down.

lit. Miscellaneous supplies are scattered around, often tipped over haphazardly

[Glyphmaker Artifact; Corridor] (inside a battlesuit)
A dim corridor stretches deeper into the station. Regular alcoves are present,
each filled with the still forms of apparently robotic bipeds. Their bodies are
carved with intricate symbols and their crystalline eyes glitter as battlesuit
helmet lights pass over them.

here.

[Glyphmaker Artifact; Chamber] (inside a battlesuit)
The corridors open up into a wider chamber here. This seems rather more well
lit. Miscellaneous supplies are scattered around, often tipped over haphazardly
or spilled across the deck, as though someone left in a great hurry or someone
else has already looted the place. There is an occasional strange crystalline
container which seems largely intact, however.
You see the wreckage of Glyph Templar Alpha, a semi-transparent hexagonal
crystal container, a semi-transparent hexagonal crystal container, Lily Kaise
(League Paladin), a one-use repair drone, a one-use repair drone, an energy
bottle, a space-grade detonator, a piece of a Glyph defender, and a damaged
Glyphmaker artificial brain here.
You can go north, east, south, west, and down.
Lily Kaise picks up a piece of a Glyph defender.
Lily Kaise picks up a damaged Glyphmaker artificial brain.

[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room] (inside a battlesuit)
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a small white trash bin, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a shiny round deep sapphire blue table with a
painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple trees, a greater minimodule of
minidrones boost, a greater minimodule of energy capacity and energy generation,
an insulated red cooler, a blue plastic food storage container, and a
pocket-sized purple holovid here.
You can go up and out.
Lily Kaise (League Paladin) returns from deep space.
exit
You tongue a control inside your battlesuit, which immediately splits down the
front. You carefully climb out.

sort of oil coating every surface, including the robotic warriors.

(20 seconds roundtime.)
[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room] (inside a battlesuit)
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a small white trash bin, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a shiny round deep sapphire blue table with a
painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple trees, a greater minimodule of
minidrones boost, a greater minimodule of energy capacity and energy generation,
an insulated red cooler, a blue plastic food storage container, a pocket-sized
purple holovid, and a Tardick lizard named Asteria here.
You can go up and out.
Lily Kaise (League Paladin) returns from deep space.
exit
You tongue a control inside your battlesuit, which immediately splits down the
front. You carefully climb out.

[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room] (inside a battlesuit)
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a small white trash bin, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a shiny round deep sapphire blue table with a
painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple trees, a greater minimodule of
minidrones boost, a greater minimodule of energy capacity and energy generation,
an insulated red cooler, a pocket-sized purple holovid, a compact red
refrigerator, a blue plastic food storage container, and a red plastic food
storage container here.
You can go up and out.
Lily Kaise (League Paladin) returns from deep space.
A League Paladin suddenly splits down the front and deposits Lily Kaise.
Lily Kaise sits down on a large purple and lavender paisley floor pillow with
thick silver fringe.
exit
You tongue a control inside your battlesuit, which immediately splits down the
front. You carefully climb out.

[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room] (inside a battlesuit)
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a small white trash bin, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a shiny round deep sapphire blue table with a
painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple trees, a greater minimodule of
minidrones boost, a greater minimodule of energy capacity and energy generation,
an insulated red cooler, a pocket-sized purple holovid, a compact red
refrigerator, a blue plastic food storage container, a red plastic food storage
container, and Lily Kaise (League Paladin) here.
You can go up and out.
exit
You tongue a control inside your battlesuit, which immediately splits down the
front. You carefully climb out.

(20 seconds roundtime.)
[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room] (inside a battlesuit)
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a small white trash bin, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a shiny round deep sapphire blue table with a
painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple trees, a greater minimodule of
minidrones boost, a greater minimodule of energy capacity and energy generation,
an insulated red cooler, a pocket-sized purple holovid, a compact red
refrigerator, a blue plastic food storage container, a red plastic food storage
container, and Lily Kaise (League Paladin) here.
You can go up and out.
A League Paladin suddenly splits down the front and deposits Lily Kaise.
exit
You tongue a control inside your battlesuit, which immediately splits down the
front. You carefully climb out.

[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room]
You see a small white trash bin, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a shiny round deep sapphire blue table with a
painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple trees, a greater minimodule of
minidrones boost, a greater minimodule of energy capacity and energy generation,
an insulated red cooler, a pocket-sized purple holovid, a compact red
refrigerator, a blue plastic food storage container, a red plastic food storage
container, a League Paladin, an AEU Combat Universalist, and a Tardick lizard
named Asteria here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on a large purple and lavender paisley floor pillow.
You can go up and out.

You kiss Lily Kaise.

Paradise Vineyards Pinot Grigio.

Paradise Vineyards Pinot Grigio.

[Glyphmaker Artifact; Chamber] (inside a battlesuit)
The corridors open up into a wider chamber here. This seems rather more well
lit. Miscellaneous supplies are scattered around, often tipped over haphazardly
or spilled across the deck, as though someone left in a great hurry or someone
else has already looted the place. There is an occasional strange crystalline
container which seems largely intact, however.
You see a large blast door, the wreckage of Glyph Soldier Alpha, Lily Kaise
(League Paladin), and a saffron glyph here.
You can go north and south.

away.

[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room] (inside a battlesuit)
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a small white trash bin, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a shiny round deep sapphire blue table with a
painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple trees, a greater minimodule of
minidrones boost, a greater minimodule of energy capacity and energy generation,
an insulated red cooler, a pocket-sized purple holovid, a compact red
refrigerator, a blue plastic food storage container, and a red plastic food
storage container here.
You can go up and out.
Lily Kaise (League Paladin) returns from deep space.
A League Paladin suddenly splits down the front and deposits Lily Kaise.
Lily Kaise sits down on a large purple and lavender paisley floor pillow with
thick silver fringe.
Lily Kaise makes a selection on the AutoVector control board.
The starship transitions into another sector.

[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room]
You see a small white trash bin, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a shiny round deep sapphire blue table with a
painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple trees, a greater minimodule of
minidrones boost, a greater minimodule of energy capacity and energy generation,
an insulated red cooler, a pocket-sized purple holovid, a compact red
refrigerator, a blue plastic food storage container, a red plastic food storage
container, an AEU Combat Universalist, and a League Paladin here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on a large purple and lavender paisley floor pillow.
You can go up and out.
Lily Kaise flicks a small switch.
A small light next to the word AUTOPILOT switches on, while a similar light next
to the word MANUAL switches off.
Lily Kaise presses a button and brings up the starship's navigation controls.
A destination appears on the ship's navigation controls: Glyphmakers' Station
(nearest).
Lily Kaise lifts a small plastic cover and presses a green button.
You hear a single beep and glance up to see green lights flick on overhead as
the ship enters normal status.
A low hum you had barely noticed until now slowly fades away as weapons are
powered down.

[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room] (inside a battlesuit)
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a small white trash bin, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a shiny round deep sapphire blue table with a
painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple trees, a greater minimodule of
minidrones boost, a greater minimodule of energy capacity and energy generation,
an insulated red cooler, a pocket-sized purple holovid, a compact red
refrigerator, a blue plastic food storage container, and a red plastic food
storage container here.
You can go up and out.
Lily Kaise (League Paladin) returns from deep space.
exit
You tongue a control inside your battlesuit, which immediately splits down the
front. You carefully climb out.

[Glyphmaker Artifact; Chamber] (inside a battlesuit)
The corridors open up into a wider chamber here. This seems rather more well
lit. Miscellaneous supplies are scattered around, often tipped over haphazardly
or spilled across the deck, as though someone left in a great hurry or someone
else has already looted the place. There is an occasional strange crystalline
container which seems largely intact, however.

energy bottle here.

(20 seconds roundtime.)
[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room] (inside a battlesuit)
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.

A wormhole suddenly appears in front of the ship, its edges tinged an unusual
deep purple. Strange undulating shapes are half-visible deep inside it.
A thick undulating mist suddenly seems to rush toward the starship from every
direction, quickly blotting out the stars. Random shapes, some half-familiar,
occasionally form in the mist only to disappear almost immediately.
The starship has left a unique area of space.
A formless mist suddenly swirls outside the viewports, then is rapidly sucked
forward into a bright wormhole in front of the ship. The wormhole blinks out of
existence, and the ship is suddenly in normal space.
The computer announces, "Autotravel destination reached."

Lily Kaise
She appears to be 27 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average breasts. Her
face is oval and pretty, with a delicate nose and understated chin. Her lips are
lovely and blush pink and occasionally part to reveal a set of pretty teeth.
Beneath a set of arched eyebrows, her eyes are blue-green and almond-shaped. Her
mid-back length, straight hair is pale honey blonde and swept up into a thick
fall of loose curls down her back. She has oval pink fingernails.
A small enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe and a small
enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.
 She is wearing a soft mystic purple nightshirt with the Business Cats logo on
the front. She is also wearing an orange and white blessed prayer bracelet
around her wrist, a slender bracelet of tiny tinkling silver bells around her
wrist, a neon purple wrist-mounted chronometer, a solid silver ring engraved
with dragonflies, a delicate ring of silver wire and small purple amethyst
crystals, a metallic gold touch einrophone in a metallic purple reinforced
plastic phone holster, and a soft fuchsia Tardick lizard snuggly labeled
'Asteria'. Her head, face, both eyes, neck, both wrists, both hands, both knees,
both calves, both ankles, and both feet are left uncovered.
She is carrying nothing.

then hopefully you do not have to worry about the beard. If you hate your beard,
Beard-B-Gone is also available.

open suitcase

undress into suitcase
You remove all of your clothing, placing it carefully in a small suitcase.
take briefs

wear briefs

take polo
You need a free hand to take that.
wear trousers
You pull a pair of slim Sahara sand linen trousers on over your legs.
take polo
You remove a soft Bahama blue cotton polo from a small suitcase.
wear polo

take black socks
You remove a pair of black socks from a small suitcase.
wear socks
You slide a pair of black socks onto your feet.
take sneakers from suitcase

wear sneakers

 You are wearing a soft Bahama blue cotton polo, a pair of slim Sahara sand
linen trousers, and a pair of washed light khaki canvas sneakers. Underneath
this, you are wearing a pair of white cotton briefs and a pair of black socks.
You are also wearing a keychain, a metallic gold touch einrophone in a black
leather phone holster, a gold wrist-mounted chronometer, a metallic silver
metachannel FTL communicator, a solid silver ring engraved with dolphins, a
black guitar case, and a backpack. You are concealing a leather briefcase, a
golden Feng Wo coin purse, a black flightbag with a red shooting star on the
side, a camera bag, an asteroid hauling supply kit, a flight control scanner, a
large expandable telescoping xenology container, a black engineering tool case,
a thick synthleather bandolier with large pockets, and a scorched metal thigh
holster. Your head, face, both eyes, neck, both elbows, both forearms, both
wrists, and both hands are left uncovered.
You are carrying nothing.
l me
Shule Elemmire
He appears to be 26 years old. He is about six feet and two inches tall and has
olive skin. His body is athletic with muscled hips and strong calves. He has
average-sized shoulders and a wide chest. His face is average-shaped and
handsome, with a broad nose and strong chin. His lips are thin and tan and
occasionally part to reveal a set of fairly white teeth. Beneath a set of arched
eyebrows, his eyes are blue-grey and round. His shoulder-length, straight hair
is blonde and neatly trimmed over the ears and parted on the side. He has large
brownish fingernails.
 He is wearing a soft Bahama blue cotton polo, a pair of slim Sahara sand linen
trousers, and a pair of washed light khaki canvas sneakers. He is also wearing a
keychain, a metallic gold touch einrophone in a black leather phone holster, a
gold wrist-mounted chronometer, a metallic silver metachannel FTL communicator,
a solid silver ring engraved with dolphins, a black guitar case, and a backpack.
His head, face, both eyes, neck, both elbows, both forearms, both wrists, and
both hands are left uncovered.
He is carrying nothing.
l
[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at League Recharging Battery-Powered Temporary
Station; Docking Bay.
You see a small white trash bin, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a shiny round deep sapphire blue table with a
painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple trees, a greater minimodule of
minidrones boost, a greater minimodule of energy capacity and energy generation,
an insulated red cooler, a pocket-sized purple holovid, a compact red
refrigerator, a blue plastic food storage container, a red plastic food storage
container, an AEU Combat Universalist, and a League Paladin here.
You can go up and out.

[Starship "Seventh Star"; Weapons Room]
Unlike the control room, a starship's weapon room has only one tiny viewport.
The focus of the room is a slightly miniaturized starmap, augmented with
additional spatial relationship information and various status displays. A
streamlined control board sits before the starmap, with prominent indicators for
lock status and weapon readiness. Control boards for the ship's weaponry are off
to either side, to be pulled into place at a moment's notice. The status lights
overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the windows, you see
that the ship is at League Recharging Battery-Powered Temporary Station; Docking
Bay.
You see a bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Starseekers &
Troubleshooters", a white four poster rattan bed with a heart-shaped headboard
and filmy deep purple hangings with a set of lavender silk sheets, a soft
periwinkle cashmere blanket, a hand-made purple and amethyst flower quilt, a
large periwinkle bed pillow, and a large periwinkle bed pillow on it, and a

[Notification from Starseekers] The organization has received 1,443,765.89 EAOS
credits from a toll payment to League Rift Accelerating Solar Toll Station in

l
[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at League Recharging Battery-Powered Temporary
Station; Docking Bay.
You see a small white trash bin, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a shiny round deep sapphire blue table with a
painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple trees, a greater minimodule of
minidrones boost, a greater minimodule of energy capacity and energy generation,
an insulated red cooler, a pocket-sized purple holovid, a compact red
refrigerator, a blue plastic food storage container, a red plastic food storage
container, an AEU Combat Universalist, a League Paladin, and a Tardick lizard
named Asteria here.
You can go up and out.

[Starship "Seventh Star"; Weapons Room]
Unlike the control room, a starship's weapon room has only one tiny viewport.
The focus of the room is a slightly miniaturized starmap, augmented with
additional spatial relationship information and various status displays. A
streamlined control board sits before the starmap, with prominent indicators for
lock status and weapon readiness. Control boards for the ship's weaponry are off
to either side, to be pulled into place at a moment's notice. The status lights
overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the windows, you see
that the ship is at League Recharging Battery-Powered Temporary Station; Docking
Bay.

linen trousers, and a pair of washed light khaki canvas sneakers. Underneath
this, you are wearing a pair of white cotton briefs and a pair of black socks.
You are also wearing a keychain, a metallic gold touch einrophone in a black
leather phone holster, a gold wrist-mounted chronometer, a metallic silver
metachannel FTL communicator, a solid silver ring engraved with dolphins, a
black guitar case, and a backpack. You are concealing a leather briefcase, a
golden Feng Wo coin purse, a black flightbag with a red shooting star on the
side, a camera bag, an asteroid hauling supply kit, a flight control scanner, a
large expandable telescoping xenology container, a black engineering tool case,
a thick synthleather bandolier with large pockets, and a scorched metal thigh
holster. Your head, face, both eyes, neck, both elbows, both forearms, both
wrists, and both hands are left uncovered.

l lily
Lily Kaise
She appears to be 27 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average breasts. Her
face is oval and pretty, with a delicate nose and understated chin. Her lips are
lovely and blush pink and occasionally part to reveal a set of pretty teeth.
Beneath a set of arched eyebrows, her eyes are blue-green and almond-shaped. Her
mid-back length, straight hair is pale honey blonde and swept up into a thick
fall of loose curls down her back. She has oval pink fingernails.
A small enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe and a small
enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.
 She is wearing a long-sleeved dark blue tee appliqued with small neon pink
dragonflies, a pair of skinny blue low rise jeans, and a pair of hot pink canvas
sneakers. She is also wearing an orange and white blessed prayer bracelet around
her wrist, a slender bracelet of tiny tinkling silver bells around her wrist, a
neon purple wrist-mounted chronometer, a solid silver ring engraved with
dragonflies, a delicate ring of silver wire and small purple amethyst crystals,
a metallic gold touch einrophone in a metallic purple reinforced plastic phone
holster, and a soft fuchsia Tardick lizard snuggly labeled 'Asteria'. Her head,
face, both eyes, neck, both wrists, both hands, and waist are left uncovered.
She is carrying a large mug of hot hazelnut coffee with whipped cream and
cinnamon in her left hand.
Lily Kaise cuddles up to you.
smile lily
You smile at Lily Kaise.
cuddle lily

Lily Kaise asks in a New Earth accent, "You ready to rock some graveyard?"

from her.

from the various starship systems.

Lily Kaise flips a number of failsafe switches on the rift drive control board,
then pushes a heavy lever forward.
Something deep inside the starship roars to life as the lights dim sharply.

A wormhole suddenly appears in front of the ship, its edges tinged an unusual
deep purple. Strange undulating shapes are half-visible deep inside it.
A thick undulating mist suddenly seems to rush toward the starship from every
direction, quickly blotting out the stars. Random shapes, some half-familiar,
occasionally form in the mist only to disappear almost immediately.
The starship has entered a unique area of space.
This area of space seems largely clear and empty, but the ship's computer is
detecting hints of tightbeam transmissions no longer in alignment. The
transmissions have the regularity of automated machinespeak.
A formless mist suddenly swirls outside the viewports, then is rapidly sucked
forward into a bright wormhole in front of the ship. The wormhole blinks out of
existence, and the ship is suddenly in normal space.

for a moment.

[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room] (inside a battlesuit)
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a small white trash bin, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a shiny round deep sapphire blue table with a
painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple trees, a greater minimodule of
minidrones boost, a greater minimodule of energy capacity and energy generation,
an insulated red cooler, a pocket-sized purple holovid, a compact red
refrigerator, a blue plastic food storage container, a red plastic food storage
container, and a clear plastic food storage container here.
You can go up and out.
Lily Kaise (League Paladin) returns from deep space.
exit
You tongue a control inside your battlesuit, which immediately splits down the
front. You carefully climb out.

refrigerator, a blue plastic food storage container, a red plastic food storage

[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on red alert. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a small white trash bin, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a shiny round deep sapphire blue table with a
painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple trees, a greater minimodule of
minidrones boost, a greater minimodule of energy capacity and energy generation,
an insulated red cooler, a pocket-sized purple holovid, a compact red
refrigerator, a blue plastic food storage container, a red plastic food storage
container, a clear plastic food storage container, an AEU Combat Universalist, a
League Paladin, and Lily Kaise's workbench here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on a large purple and lavender paisley floor pillow.
You can go up and out.

[Glyphmaker Artifact; Belowdecks] (inside a battlesuit)
This corridor goes under the station's main deck, and seems even darker.
Everything down here seems oddly better maintained, with a shiny layer of some
sort of oil coating every surface, including the robotic warriors.
You see the wreckage of Glyph Knight Alpha, the wreckage of Glyph Knight Beta,
and Lily Kaise (League Paladin) here.
You can go southwest and up.

launch

(20 seconds roundtime.)
[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room] (inside a battlesuit)
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a small white trash bin, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a shiny round deep sapphire blue table with a
painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple trees, a greater minimodule of
minidrones boost, a greater minimodule of energy capacity and energy generation,
an insulated red cooler, a pocket-sized purple holovid, a compact red
refrigerator, a blue plastic food storage container, a red plastic food storage
container, a clear plastic food storage container, and Lily Kaise's workbench
here.
You can go up and out.
Lily Kaise (League Paladin) returns from deep space.
exit
You tongue a control inside your battlesuit, which immediately splits down the
front. You carefully climb out.
[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room]
You see a small white trash bin, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a shiny round deep sapphire blue table with a
painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple trees, a greater minimodule of
minidrones boost, a greater minimodule of energy capacity and energy generation,
an insulated red cooler, a pocket-sized purple holovid, a compact red
refrigerator, a blue plastic food storage container, a red plastic food storage
container, a clear plastic food storage container, Lily Kaise's workbench, an
AEU Combat Universalist, and Lily Kaise (League Paladin) here.
You can go up and out.
You collect the items you retrieved from the battle and place them into a
leather briefcase.

Something deep inside the starship roars to life as the lights dim sharply.
A wormhole suddenly appears in front of the ship, its edges tinged an unusual
deep purple. Strange undulating shapes are half-visible deep inside it.
A thick undulating mist suddenly seems to rush toward the starship from every
direction, quickly blotting out the stars. Random shapes, some half-familiar,
occasionally form in the mist only to disappear almost immediately.
The starship has left a unique area of space.
A formless mist suddenly swirls outside the viewports, then is rapidly sucked
forward into a bright wormhole in front of the ship. The wormhole blinks out of
existence, and the ship is suddenly in normal space.
The computer announces, "Autotravel destination reached."

[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at Starship "Star Of Destiny"; Docking Bay.
You see a small white trash bin, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a shiny round deep sapphire blue table with a
painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple trees, a greater minimodule of
minidrones boost, a greater minimodule of energy capacity and energy generation,
a pocket-sized purple holovid, a compact red refrigerator, a blue plastic food
storage container, a red plastic food storage container, an AEU Combat
Universalist, and a League Paladin here.
You can go up and out.

l lily
Lily Kaise
She appears to be 27 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average breasts. Her
face is oval and pretty, with a delicate nose and understated chin. Her lips are
lovely and blush pink and occasionally part to reveal a set of pretty teeth.
Beneath a set of arched eyebrows, her eyes are blue-green and almond-shaped. Her
mid-back length, straight hair is pale honey blonde and swept up into a thick
fall of loose curls down her back. She has oval pink fingernails.
A small enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe and a small
enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.
 She is wearing a long-sleeved dark blue tee appliqued with small neon pink
dragonflies, a pair of skinny blue low rise jeans, and a pair of hot pink canvas
sneakers. She is also wearing an orange and white blessed prayer bracelet around
her wrist, a slender bracelet of tiny tinkling silver bells around her wrist, a
neon purple wrist-mounted chronometer, a solid silver ring engraved with
dragonflies, a delicate ring of silver wire and small purple amethyst crystals,
a metallic gold touch einrophone in a metallic purple reinforced plastic phone
holster, and a soft fuchsia Tardick lizard snuggly containing a Tardick lizard
named Asteria. Her head, face, both eyes, neck, both wrists, both hands, and
waist are left uncovered.
She is carrying a cup of hot French vanilla coffee in her right hand.

sensors have detected a new location of interest in the riftflow.

Asteria. The lizard's tongue flicks out once, then its head lunges forward,
snapping up the food in a sudden blur and immediately swallowing it whole.
Lily Kaise sits down on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made
white and sapphire star quilt on it.
A long orange soft-bodied creature with many claw-tipped tentacles rears up
suddenly from behind a plastic wrecked EAOS Defender and wraps its tentacles
around it as if trying to drag it into the deep.
A Tardick lizard named Asteria flicks its tongue out.
A Tardick lizard named Asteria trundles slowly south.
[General Communication] A robotic voice says, "Incoming QE message from Yadira
Rivera."
[Notification from Starseekers] 1 megacredit has been spent on the
organization's hyperwave relay rental contract.
A metallic gold touch einrophone beeps quietly for attention, indicating a new
post in General/Name Changes.
A metallic silver metachannel FTL communicator chimes softly as it receives a
new notice.
A medium-sized thickly-shelled creature with a red shell and four small claws
creeps across the bottom of the tank, snapping its many claws rapidly.
Lily Kaise navigates her metallic gold touch einrophone to a text-heavy
application and peers at the screen.
[General Communication] Mike Marshall transmits, "I don't see how to get to 134
anymore."
[AEU | 10: Conquest Status] An AEU pilot corps liaison transmits, "I see some
activity underway, but no performance goals reached yet! Let's keep going!"
[Notification from Starseekers] The organization has received 985,040.14 EAOS
credits from a toll payment to League Rift Accelerating Battery-Powered Toll
Station in Waypoint Alpha 135.

[Teslatown; Finial Avenue] (inside a battlesuit)
Finial Avenue is a length of rather scorched concrete lined by the series of
tall lightning rods that gives it its name. An arching metal lattice overhead
and to either side forms a Faraday cage that keeps out electrical energy.
Scientists and technicians walk up and down the street, wearing environmental
suits which also act as Faraday cages in addition to possessing bulky cooling
units. Among these people occasionally stride even larger figures: people in
powered armor, their suits designed both for environmental protection and
intense ground combat.
You can go north and south.

over its entirety, by far the largest such construct on the planet. The massive
cage encloses Teleforce Tom's Lounge and Pub as well as the Electrostatic
Exchange.

ftl museum
The League's legendary shipyards hang motionless in the dark here. Once, the
stations would be all but glowing with waste heat as the Intersector
Shipbuilding Company rolled out ship after ship. Now the stations are still and
darkened, and the ISC is no more.

sit pillow
You sit down on a large purple and lavender paisley floor pillow with thick
silver fringe.
Lily Kaise grasps a large lever on the control board and pushes it slowly away
from her.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
Lily Kaise uses the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
take red cooler from briefcase

launch. Good luck and come back to us safely."
drop red cooler

The computer reports that the two-person medium transport "Registered Merchant
611" has jumped into the sector.

embroidered with brightly hued butterflies.

Merchant 611! Welcome to New Earth Orbit!"

611" has docked with Space Station Alpha.

Star, be advised that the Free Port Doctrine is in effect here."

A destination appears on the ship's navigation controls: Quantum Skim
Accelerator to The Cross.
You feel the ship shudder slightly as it approaches a quantum skim accelerator.
The computer announces, "Initiating connection with The Cross's local quantum
skim accelerator network."
The computer announces, "Connection established. Communicating between quantum
skim acceleration gates now."

You feel the deck underneath you shudder violently, and you stumble slightly.

Galactic East."

Lily Kaise presses a button and brings up the FTL flight control board.
Lily Kaise transfers a toll payment to a local rift accelerator.
[Notification from Starseekers] The organization has received 4,274,953.55 EAOS
credits from a toll payment to League Rift Accelerating Battery-Powered Toll
Station in Home Beacon Gamma 001.
The computer announces, "Setting course to Outpost H-101. Local rift accelerator
with matching vector found."
Something deep inside the starship roars to life as the lights dim sharply.
A wormhole suddenly appears in front of the ship, its edges tinged an unusual
deep purple. Strange undulating shapes are half-visible deep inside it.
A thick undulating mist suddenly seems to rush toward the starship from every
direction, quickly blotting out the stars. Random shapes, some half-familiar,
occasionally form in the mist only to disappear almost immediately.
The computer beeps in an imperative manner and informs you that the starship's
sensors have detected a new location of interest in the riftflow.
A high pitched whistling sound screams overhead as a mortar shell flies through
the air. It explodes nearby with tremendous force, and when the dust and smoke
clears, the starship is gone, replaced with a deep earthen trench and the sounds
of battle.
'oy!
You exclaim, "Oy!"
Lily Kaise says in a New Earth accent, "Yikes."
l
[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room]
This earthen trench has been dug deep into the ground; the walls are reinforced
with wooden beams and stacked crates of ammunition. It has rained recently, and
the ground is slick and muddy. An ever-present fog hangs heavily in the air,
thick with the smell of gunpowder and death. Lights overhead indicate that the
ship is on green status. Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is
inside the riftflow.
You see a small white trash bin, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a shiny round deep sapphire blue table with a
painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple trees, a greater minimodule of
minidrones boost, a greater minimodule of energy capacity and energy generation,
Kiska the humanoid service robot, an insulated red cooler, and a compact red
refrigerator here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on a large purple and lavender paisley floor pillow.

[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room] (inside a battlesuit)
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a small white trash bin, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a shiny round deep sapphire blue table with a
painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple trees, a greater minimodule of
minidrones boost, Kiska the humanoid service robot, an insulated red cooler, a
compact red refrigerator, a red plastic food storage container, a clear plastic
food storage container, a blue plastic food storage container, and an insulated
green cooler here.
You can go up and out.
Lily Kaise (League Paladin) returns from deep space.
A League Paladin suddenly splits down the front and deposits Lily Kaise.
Lily Kaise sits down on a large purple and lavender paisley floor pillow with
thick silver fringe.
Lily Kaise makes a selection on the AutoVector control board.
exit
You tongue a control inside your battlesuit, which immediately splits down the
front. You carefully climb out.

(20 seconds roundtime.)
[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room] (inside a battlesuit)
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a small white trash bin, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a shiny round deep sapphire blue table with a
painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple trees, a greater minimodule of
minidrones boost, Kiska the humanoid service robot, an insulated red cooler, a
compact red refrigerator, a red plastic food storage container, a clear plastic
food storage container, a blue plastic food storage container, and an insulated
green cooler here.
You can go up and out.
Lily Kaise (League Paladin) returns from deep space.
A League Paladin suddenly splits down the front and deposits Lily Kaise.
Lily Kaise sits down on a large purple and lavender paisley floor pillow with
thick silver fringe.
Lily Kaise makes a selection on the AutoVector control board.
Lily Kaise carefully removes a Tardick lizard named Asteria from her shoulder.
exit
You tongue a control inside your battlesuit, which immediately splits down the
front. You carefully climb out.
[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room]
You see a small white trash bin, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a shiny round deep sapphire blue table with a
painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple trees, a greater minimodule of
minidrones boost, Kiska the humanoid service robot, an insulated red cooler, a
compact red refrigerator, a red plastic food storage container, a clear plastic
food storage container, a blue plastic food storage container, an insulated
green cooler, an AEU Combat Universalist, and a League Paladin here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on a large purple and lavender paisley floor pillow.
You can go up and out.
You collect the items you retrieved from the battle and place them into a
leather briefcase.
u
[Starship "Seventh Star"; Weapons Room]

headboard and filmy deep purple hangings with a set of lavender silk sheets, a
soft periwinkle cashmere blanket, a hand-made purple and amethyst flower quilt,
a large periwinkle bed pillow, and a large periwinkle bed pillow on it here.

[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room]
You see a small white trash bin, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a shiny round deep sapphire blue table with a
painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple trees, a greater minimodule of
minidrones boost, Kiska the humanoid service robot, an insulated red cooler, a
compact red refrigerator, a red plastic food storage container, a clear plastic
food storage container, a blue plastic food storage container, an insulated
green cooler, an AEU Combat Universalist, and a League Paladin here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on a large purple and lavender paisley floor pillow.

silver fringe.

i
 You are wearing a soft Bahama blue cotton polo, a pair of slim Sahara sand
linen trousers, and a pair of washed light khaki canvas sneakers. Underneath
this, you are wearing a pair of white cotton briefs and a pair of black socks.
You are also wearing a keychain, a metallic gold touch einrophone in a black
leather phone holster, a gold wrist-mounted chronometer, a metallic silver
metachannel FTL communicator, a solid silver ring engraved with dolphins, a
black guitar case, and a backpack. You are concealing a leather briefcase, a
golden Feng Wo coin purse, a black flightbag with a red shooting star on the
side, a camera bag, an asteroid hauling supply kit, a flight control scanner, a
large expandable telescoping xenology container, a black engineering tool case,
a thick synthleather bandolier with large pockets, and a scorched metal thigh
holster. Your head, face, both eyes, neck, both elbows, both forearms, both
wrists, and both hands are left uncovered.
You are carrying Shule Elemmire's workbench in your right hand, and a mango
margarita in your left hand.

enough ground duty."

[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room]
You see a small white trash bin, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a shiny round deep sapphire blue table with a
painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple trees, a greater minimodule of
minidrones boost, Kiska the humanoid service robot, an insulated red cooler, a
compact red refrigerator, a red plastic food storage container, a clear plastic
food storage container, a blue plastic food storage container, an insulated
green cooler, an AEU Combat Universalist, a League Paladin, and a Tardick lizard
named Asteria here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on a large purple and lavender paisley floor pillow.
You can go up and out.
Lily Kaise lifts a small plastic cover and presses a green button.
You hear a single beep and glance up to see green lights flick on overhead as
the ship enters normal status.
A low hum you had barely noticed until now slowly fades away as weapons are
powered down.

A dim corridor stretches deeper into the station. Regular alcoves are present,

helmet lights pass over them.

[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room] (inside a battlesuit)
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a small white trash bin, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a shiny round deep sapphire blue table with a
painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple trees, a greater minimodule of
minidrones boost, Kiska the humanoid service robot, an insulated red cooler, a
compact red refrigerator, a red plastic food storage container, a clear plastic
food storage container, a blue plastic food storage container, and an insulated
green cooler here.
You can go up and out.
Lily Kaise (League Paladin) returns from deep space.
A League Paladin suddenly splits down the front and deposits Lily Kaise.
Lily Kaise sits down on a large purple and lavender paisley floor pillow with
thick silver fringe.
Lily Kaise makes a selection on the AutoVector control board.
exit
You tongue a control inside your battlesuit, which immediately splits down the
front. You carefully climb out.
