[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a small white trash bin, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a shiny round deep sapphire blue table with a
painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple trees, a greater minimodule of
minidrones boost, Kiska the humanoid service robot, an insulated red cooler, a
compact red refrigerator, a red plastic food storage container, a clear plastic
food storage container, a blue plastic food storage container, an insulated
green cooler, an AEU Combat Universalist, a League Paladin, and a Tardick lizard
named Asteria here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on a large purple and lavender paisley floor pillow.
You can go up and out.

[Glyphmaker Artifact; Belowdecks] (inside a battlesuit)
This corridor goes under the station's main deck, and seems even darker.

sort of oil coating every surface, including the robotic warriors.

[Glyphmaker Artifact; Chamber] (inside a battlesuit)
The corridors open up into a wider chamber here. This seems rather more well
lit. Miscellaneous supplies are scattered around, often tipped over haphazardly
or spilled across the deck, as though someone left in a great hurry or someone
else has already looted the place. There is an occasional strange crystalline
container which seems largely intact, however.

[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room] (inside a battlesuit)
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a small white trash bin, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a shiny round deep sapphire blue table with a
painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple trees, a greater minimodule of
minidrones boost, Kiska the humanoid service robot, an insulated red cooler, a
compact red refrigerator, a red plastic food storage container, a clear plastic
food storage container, a blue plastic food storage container, an insulated
green cooler, and a Tardick lizard named Asteria here.
You can go up and out.
exit
You tongue a control inside your battlesuit, which immediately splits down the
front. You carefully climb out.

League Paladin here.

(nearest).

[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room] (inside a battlesuit)
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a small white trash bin, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a shiny round deep sapphire blue table with a
painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple trees, a greater minimodule of
minidrones boost, Kiska the humanoid service robot, an insulated red cooler, a
compact red refrigerator, a red plastic food storage container, a clear plastic
food storage container, a blue plastic food storage container, an insulated
green cooler, and Lily Kaise (League Paladin) here.
You can go up and out.
A League Paladin suddenly splits down the front and deposits Lily Kaise.
Lily Kaise sits down on a large purple and lavender paisley floor pillow with
thick silver fringe.
exit
You tongue a control inside your battlesuit, which immediately splits down the
front. You carefully climb out.

(20 seconds roundtime.)
[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room] (inside a battlesuit)
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a small white trash bin, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a shiny round deep sapphire blue table with a
painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple trees, a greater minimodule of
minidrones boost, Kiska the humanoid service robot, an insulated red cooler, a

l lily
Lily Kaise
She appears to be 27 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average breasts. Her
face is oval and pretty, with a delicate nose and understated chin. Her lips are
lovely and blush pink and occasionally part to reveal a set of pretty teeth.
Beneath a set of arched eyebrows, her eyes are blue-green and almond-shaped. Her
mid-back length, straight hair is pale honey blonde and swept up into a thick
fall of loose curls down her back. She has oval pink fingernails.
A small enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe and a small
enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.
 She is wearing a long-sleeved dark blue tee appliqued with small neon pink
dragonflies, a pair of skinny blue low rise jeans, and a pair of hot pink canvas
sneakers. She is also wearing an orange and white blessed prayer bracelet around
her wrist, a slender bracelet of tiny tinkling silver bells around her wrist, a
neon purple wrist-mounted chronometer, a solid silver ring engraved with
dragonflies, a delicate ring of silver wire and small purple amethyst crystals,
a metallic gold touch einrophone in a metallic purple reinforced plastic phone

She appears to be 27 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average breasts. Her
abdomen is attractive and punctuated by a cute navel. Her face is oval and
pretty, with a delicate nose and understated chin. Her lips are lovely and blush
pink and occasionally part to reveal a set of pretty teeth. Beneath a set of
arched eyebrows, her eyes are blue-green and almond-shaped. Her mid-back length,
straight hair is pale honey blonde and swept up into a thick fall of loose curls
down her back. She has oval pink fingernails.

cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe, and a small enameled cerulean
blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.

[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room] (inside a battlesuit)
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a small white trash bin, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a shiny round deep sapphire blue table with a
painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple trees, a greater minimodule of
minidrones boost, Kiska the humanoid service robot, an insulated red cooler, a
compact red refrigerator, a red plastic food storage container, a clear plastic
food storage container, a blue plastic food storage container, and an insulated
green cooler here.
You can go up and out.
Lily Kaise (League Paladin) returns from deep space.
exit
You tongue a control inside your battlesuit, which immediately splits down the
front. You carefully climb out.
[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room]
You see a small white trash bin, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a shiny round deep sapphire blue table with a
painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple trees, a greater minimodule of
minidrones boost, Kiska the humanoid service robot, an insulated red cooler, a
compact red refrigerator, a red plastic food storage container, a clear plastic
food storage container, a blue plastic food storage container, an insulated
green cooler, an AEU Combat Universalist, and Lily Kaise (League Paladin) here.

A wormhole suddenly appears in front of the ship, its edges tinged an unusual
deep purple. Strange undulating shapes are half-visible deep inside it.
A thick undulating mist suddenly seems to rush toward the starship from every
direction, quickly blotting out the stars. Random shapes, some half-familiar,
occasionally form in the mist only to disappear almost immediately.

forward into a bright wormhole in front of the ship. The wormhole blinks out of
existence, and the ship is suddenly in normal space.

[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is at League Recharging Battery-Powered Temporary Station;
Docking Bay.
You see a small white trash bin, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a shiny round deep sapphire blue table with a
painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple trees, a greater minimodule of
minidrones boost, Kiska the humanoid service robot, an insulated red cooler, a
compact red refrigerator, a red plastic food storage container, a clear plastic
food storage container, a blue plastic food storage container, an insulated
green cooler, an AEU Combat Universalist, and a League Paladin here.

Subject: Improved Engineering Technique Toolset available
Author: Akemi Bando
Posted: 16:30  2 May 2316 GST
--
I'm offering this for an asking price of 220 million EAOS, or for a trade of 20
RATS quicksynth, 20 RATS nanite capacitor parts, and one set of alien
maintenance tools plus a crafting fee of 20 million EAOS. This toolset is used
for building improved consumable engineering tools, which are appropriate for
pilots who have 500 industry points or more on their license.
--

Logged out of FTL Message Board Net.
[Notification from Starseekers] An asteroid has been received at League Asteroid
Processing Nuclear Temporary Station from the two-person isotope "IceBake". The
organization has earned 571,223.57 credits.
peer s
You peer south...
[Starship "Seventh Star"; Storage Room]
Lights overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at League Recharging Battery-Powered Temporary
Station; Docking Bay.
You see a very soft quilted light purple sleeping mat with a large lavender bed
pillow on it, a large turquoise quilt with an appliqued magenta and white lotus
blossom design, a personal hoverpallet, a small oval turquoise rattan table with
a glass top, Magellan the arachnoid security robot, and a Tardick lizard named
Asteria here.
You can go north.
[Notification from Starseekers] An asteroid has been received at League Asteroid
Processing Nuclear Temporary Station from the two-person isotope "Rock Duet".
The organization has earned 1,110,693.00 credits.
peer d
You peer down...
[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is at League Recharging Battery-Powered Temporary Station;
Docking Bay.
You see a small white trash bin, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a shiny round deep sapphire blue table with a
painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple trees, a greater minimodule of
minidrones boost, Kiska the humanoid service robot, an insulated red cooler, a
compact red refrigerator, a red plastic food storage container, a clear plastic
food storage container, a blue plastic food storage container, an insulated
green cooler, an AEU Combat Universalist, and a League Paladin here.
You can go up and out.

Processing Nuclear Temporary Station from the two-person isotope "IceBake". The
organization has earned 398,374.94 credits and 1 megacredit.

you guys."

The organization has earned 986,138.38 credits.

organization has earned 414,013.63 credits and 1 megacredit.

The organization has earned 1,826,517.30 credits.

organization has earned 422,244.51 credits.
[Notification from Starseekers] An asteroid has been received at League Asteroid
Processing Nuclear Temporary Station from the two-person isotope "Rock Duet".
The organization has earned 818,841.86 credits.
[AEU | 10: Conquest Status] An AEU pilot corps liaison transmits, "Great, we've
almost reached our first performance goal! Keep it up!"
The computer sounds a notification indicating that the ship has been fully
charged and is now shutting down.
The faint sounds and status lights of the starship's systems slowly fade away,
leaving you in a dim silence.
[General Communication] A robotic voice says, "Incoming QE message from Metal
Heart."
A Tardick lizard named Asteria trundles slowly into the area.
[AEU | 10: Conquest Status] An AEU pilot corps liaison transmits, "We're almost
to that first performance goal! Let's keep pushing!"
[General Communication] A robotic voice says, "Incoming QE message from Metal
Heart to AFW Command: 2 YR APPROACH PING <END>"
A Tardick lizard named Asteria flicks its tongue out.
A Tardick lizard named Asteria trundles slowly down.

[General Communication] Evenia Callseah transmits, "It's a melissa."

with the AE."
[General Communication] Melissa Cantrelle coughs.
[General Communication] Melissa Cantrelle transmits, "QE. No coffee yet."

excepted, no."
[General Communication] Melissa Cantrelle sighs.

or I'd have done it."
[General Communication] Ted Warburton transmits, "I can accept it but I don't
know about replying or anything."
[General Communication] Melissa Cantrelle transmits, "None is waiting for
approval."
[General Communication] Melissa Cantrelle transmits, "Someone approved mine,
obviously."
[General Communication] Ted Warburton transmits, "Are you there now?"
[General Communication] Melissa Cantrelle transmits, "There was bad flow and
they were approaching kegans crew, last logs show."
[General Communication] Ted Warburton transmits, "OK."
[General Communication] Ted Warburton transmits, "I'll go look at SVP, I have
been so busy making money I haven't been there for days]."
[General Communication] Melissa Cantrelle transmits, "I need to go make money."
[General Communication] Ted Warburton transmits, "My medium transport is about
ready for salvage now."
[General Communication] Melissa Cantrelle transmits, "I'm not even close to a
medium."
[General Communication] Ted Warburton transmits, "Just nobody better shoot me
because I haven't done the hull, weapons and such yet."
A Tardick lizard named Asteria trundles slowly into the area.
A Tardick lizard named Asteria blinks its yellow eyes slowly, utterly
indifferent to its surroundings.
A Tardick lizard named Asteria trundles slowly south.
[General Communication] Kirk Waltham transmits, "Skimming is so d<mn boring, at
leas= the|rift gives y\u #omething inter|sting <o look .t+"
[General Communication] Ted Warburton transmits, "Sometimes."
A Tardick lizard named Asteria trundles slowly into the area.
[General Communication] A robotic voice says, "Incoming QE message from Yadira
Rivera."
[AEU | 10: Conquest Status] An AEU pilot corps liaison transmits, "Great, we've
almost reached our first performance goal! Keep it up!"
A Tardick lizard named Asteria blinks its yellow eyes slowly, utterly
indifferent to its surroundings.
[General Communication] Ted Warburton transmits, "I hate it when my disabled
rat's fighter is in a sector full of reapers, so far they've always left me
alone, but I don't trust them."
A Tardick lizard named Asteria flicks its tongue out.
A Tardick lizard named Asteria trundles slowly down.
[General Communication] A robotic voice says, "Incoming QE message from Yadira
Rivera to AFW Command: SND YV 40 PLS <END>"
[General Communication] Ali Candan transmits, "Morning."
[General Communication] Mike Marshall transmits, "Morning."
[General Communication] Evenia Callseah transmits, "Ali!"
[General Communication] Ali Candan transmits, "What are you guys up to?"
[General Communication] Evenia Callseah transmits, "Not much, what about you?"
[General Communication] Mike Marshall transmits, "Well I am in a hot tub
relaxing."
[General Communication] Ted Warburton transmits, "Morning Ali, how's you? Not up
to much right now."
[General Communication] Ali Candan transmits, "Going to check my belt stuff.
After that, who knows."
[General Communication] Kirk Waltham transmits, "Don't relax too much in there
or you won't need the jets..."
[General Communication] Mike Marshall transmits, "Yes you are so right but it is
so relaxing."
[General Communication] Ted Warburton transmits, "I daren't check my belt till
I've made some more money, but at least I've bought most of the big stuff I
needed to now."
[General Communication] Mike Marshall transmits, "I need to start mine up
again.. all of my employees quit."
[General Communication] Ted Warburton transmits, "Wow, why?"
[General Communication] Kirk Waltham transmits, "Sexual harassment?"
[General Communication] Ted Warburton laughs.
[General Communication] Mike Marshall transmits, "Well I forgot to pay them and
sexual harrasment.. the guys were oh so cute."
[General Communication] Kirk Waltham transmits, "Sorry couldn't resist."
[General Communication] Mike Marshall laughs.
[General Communication] Mike Marshall transmits, "Vomit."
[General Communication] Evenia Callseah transmits, "Hey kirk, have you had any
good insertions lately?"
[General Communication] Kirk Waltham chuckles.
[General Communication] Mike Marshall transmits, "Do tell."
[General Communication] Kirk Waltham transmits, "Only the ones I've provided
myself."
[General Communication] Mike Marshall transmits, "Umm oh my."
A Tardick lizard named Asteria trundles slowly into the area.
[General Communication] Kirk Waltham transmits, "Right now I'm doing some low
deps, these rental suits aren't half bad."
[General Communication] Evenia Callseah transmits, "Oh but Kirk, you need to go
and explore, test the insertion points, just see what limits you can push it

[Starship "Seventh Star"; Weapons Room]
Unlike the control room, a starship's weapon room has only one tiny viewport.
The focus of the room is a slightly miniaturized starmap, augmented with
additional spatial relationship information and various status displays. A
streamlined control board sits before the starmap, with prominent indicators for
lock status and weapon readiness. Control boards for the ship's weaponry are off
to either side, to be pulled into place at a moment's notice. The status lights
overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the windows, you see
that the ship is at League Recharging Battery-Powered Temporary Station; Docking
Bay.
You see a bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Starseekers &
Troubleshooters", a white four poster rattan bed with a heart-shaped headboard
and filmy deep purple hangings with a set of lavender silk sheets, a soft
periwinkle cashmere blanket, a hand-made purple and amethyst flower quilt, a
large periwinkle bed pillow, and a large periwinkle bed pillow on it, and a
Tardick lizard named Asteria here.
Lily Kaise is dozing on a white four poster rattan bed.
You can go south and down.
(You are lying on a white four poster rattan bed with a heart-shaped headboard
and filmy deep purple hangings with a set of lavender silk sheets, a soft
periwinkle cashmere blanket, a hand-made purple and amethyst flower quilt, a
large periwinkle bed pillow, and a large periwinkle bed pillow on it.)

enter shower
[Shower]
You see a mesh toiletries pocket here.
You can go out.
start
You push a small button, starting the shower. Machinery starts to rumble for
several long moments, then lukewarm water begins to pour over your skin. You
feel cleaner already.
Mildly warm water continues to bathe every inch of your skin, cleansing you
thoroughly and refreshing your senses.

case.
use vinyl

use soap
You carefully wash your body with a bar of clean-smelling light green soap.
put soap in vinyl
You put a bar of clean-smelling light green soap in a small black vinyl case.
stop
You push a small button, turning the shower off. You stand, dripping, while the
air is heavy with ambient humidity.
A vacuum pump suddenly kicks in, draining additional excess water from the
shower.

l table
a shiny round deep sapphire blue table with a painted tablecloth of intertwined
sugar maple trees
Molded as though covered by a tablecloth, this round table of finely grained
plastic is painted an overall deep sapphire blue. In the center of the table top
are the intertwined roots of four sugar maple trees, each extending from the
center of the table to one of the sides and representing a season on Old Earth.
The spring tree has new light green foliage, the summer tree has dark green
leaves lightly dusted with yellow flowers, the autumn tree is covered in leaves
of deep red, orange, and yellow, and the bare branches of the winter tree spring
out and upward from the trunk, forming a complex oval against the table top's
background. The entire table is lacquered for a hard, resilient finish.
On top of it you see a small cat whittled from maple, a small hot coffee
dispenser, a small hot beverage dispenser, a small hot tea dispenser, a bulky
cylinder with a vaguely spout-like protrusion on the top, an elegant crystal
decanter, a compact purple microwave oven, a soft Bahama blue cotton polo, a
long-sleeved dark blue tee appliqued with small neon pink dragonflies, and a
pair of skinny blue low rise jeans.
take polo
You remove a soft Bahama blue cotton polo from a shiny round deep sapphire blue
table with a painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple trees.
put polo in suitcase
You open a small suitcase for a moment.
You put a soft Bahama blue cotton polo in a small suitcase.

l lily
Lily Kaise
She appears to be 27 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average breasts. Her
face is oval and pretty, with a delicate nose and understated chin. Her lips are
lovely and blush pink and occasionally part to reveal a set of pretty teeth.
Beneath a set of arched eyebrows, her eyes are blue-green and almond-shaped. Her
mid-back length, straight hair is pale honey blonde and swept up into a thick
fall of loose curls down her back. She has oval pink fingernails.
A small enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe and a small
enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.
 She is wearing a sky blue cotton chemise trimmed with delicate battenburg lace.
She is also wearing an orange and white blessed prayer bracelet around her
wrist, a slender bracelet of tiny tinkling silver bells around her wrist, a neon
purple wrist-mounted chronometer, a solid silver ring engraved with dragonflies,
a delicate ring of silver wire and small purple amethyst crystals, a metallic
gold touch einrophone in a metallic purple reinforced plastic phone holster, and
a soft fuchsia Tardick lizard snuggly labeled 'Asteria'. Her head, face, both
eyes, neck, both biceps, both elbows, both forearms, both wrists, both hands,
both ankles, and both feet are left uncovered.
She is carrying nothing.

Something deep inside the starship roars to life as the lights dim sharply.
A wormhole suddenly appears in front of the ship, its edges tinged an unusual
deep purple. Strange undulating shapes are half-visible deep inside it.
A thick undulating mist suddenly seems to rush toward the starship from every
direction, quickly blotting out the stars. Random shapes, some half-familiar,
occasionally form in the mist only to disappear almost immediately.
The starship has entered a unique area of space.
This area of space seems largely clear and empty, but the ship's computer is
detecting hints of tightbeam transmissions no longer in alignment. The
transmissions have the regularity of automated machinespeak.
A formless mist suddenly swirls outside the viewports, then is rapidly sucked
forward into a bright wormhole in front of the ship. The wormhole blinks out of
existence, and the ship is suddenly in normal space.

[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room] (inside a battlesuit)
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a small white trash bin, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a shiny round deep sapphire blue table with a
painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple trees, a greater minimodule of
minidrones boost, Kiska the humanoid service robot, an insulated red cooler, a
compact red refrigerator, a red plastic food storage container, a clear plastic
food storage container, a blue plastic food storage container, and an insulated
green cooler here.
You can go up and out.
Lily Kaise (League Paladin) returns from deep space.
eit
I don't understand that.
A League Paladin suddenly splits down the front and deposits Lily Kaise.
exit
You tongue a control inside your battlesuit, which immediately splits down the
front. You carefully climb out.

[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a small white trash bin, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a shiny round deep sapphire blue table with a
painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple trees, a greater minimodule of
minidrones boost, Kiska the humanoid service robot, an insulated red cooler, a
compact red refrigerator, a red plastic food storage container, a clear plastic
food storage container, a blue plastic food storage container, an insulated
green cooler, an AEU Combat Universalist, and a League Paladin here.
Lily Kaise is standing here.

[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a small white trash bin, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a shiny round deep sapphire blue table with a
painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple trees, a greater minimodule of
minidrones boost, Kiska the humanoid service robot, an insulated red cooler, a
compact red refrigerator, a red plastic food storage container, a clear plastic
food storage container, a blue plastic food storage container, an insulated
green cooler, an AEU Combat Universalist, and a League Paladin here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on a large purple and lavender paisley floor pillow.
You can go up and out.

for a moment.

[Glyphmaker Artifact; Chamber] (inside a battlesuit)
The corridors open up into a wider chamber here. This seems rather more well
lit. Miscellaneous supplies are scattered around, often tipped over haphazardly
or spilled across the deck, as though someone left in a great hurry or someone

container which seems largely intact, however.

[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room] (inside a battlesuit)
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a small white trash bin, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a shiny round deep sapphire blue table with a
painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple trees, a greater minimodule of
minidrones boost, Kiska the humanoid service robot, an insulated red cooler, a
compact red refrigerator, a red plastic food storage container, a blue plastic
food storage container, an insulated green cooler, and a clear plastic food
storage container here.
You can go up and out.
exit
You tongue a control inside your battlesuit, which immediately splits down the
front. You carefully climb out.

[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room] (inside a battlesuit)
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a small white trash bin, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a shiny round deep sapphire blue table with a
painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple trees, a greater minimodule of
minidrones boost, Kiska the humanoid service robot, an insulated red cooler, a
compact red refrigerator, a red plastic food storage container, a blue plastic
food storage container, an insulated green cooler, and a clear plastic food
storage container here.
You can go up and out.
exit
You tongue a control inside your battlesuit, which immediately splits down the
front. You carefully climb out.

#help shell
No help found for 'shell'
#help script
Command: #script {variable} {shell command}

         The script command works much like the system command except that it
         treats the generated echos as commands if no variable is provided.

         This is useful for running php, perl, ruby, and python scripts. You
         can run these scrips either from file or from within tintin if the
         scripting language allows this.

         If you provide a variable the output of the script is stored as a list.

Example: #script {ruby -e 'print "#showme hello world"'}
Example: #script {python -c 'print "#showme hello world"'}
Example: #script {php -r 'echo "#showme hello world"'}
Example: #script {path} {pwd};#showme The path is $path[1].
[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room] (inside a battlesuit)
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a small white trash bin, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a shiny round deep sapphire blue table with a
painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple trees, a greater minimodule of
minidrones boost, Kiska the humanoid service robot, an insulated red cooler, a
compact red refrigerator, a red plastic food storage container, a blue plastic
food storage container, an insulated green cooler, a clear plastic food storage
container, a Tardick lizard named Asteria, and Lily Kaise (League Paladin) here.
You can go up and out.
A League Paladin suddenly splits down the front and deposits Lily Kaise.
exit
You tongue a control inside your battlesuit, which immediately splits down the
front. You carefully climb out.

#help scan
Command: #scan {filename}

         The scan command reads in a file and sends its content to the screen
         as if it was send by a mud. After using scan you can use page-up and
         down to view the file.

         This command is useful to convert ansi color files to html or viewing
         raw log files.

         Reads in a file and sends it to the screen as if it was send by a mud.
         This is useful to convert ansi color file to html or viewing log file.
The starship transitions into another sector.
The starship transitions into another sector.
#help return
Command: #return {text}

         This command can be used to break out of a command string being
executed.
         If used inside a #function you can use #return with an argument to both
         break out of the function and set the result variable.
The starship transitions into another sector.
The starship transitions into another sector.
#help run
Command: #run {session name} {shell command}

         The run command works much like the system command except that it
         runs the command in a pseudo terminal. The run command also creates
         a session that treats the given shell command as a mud server. This
         allows you to run ssh, as well as any other shell application, with
         full tintin scripting capabilities

Example: #run {somewhere} {ssh someone@somewhere.com}
Example: #run {something} {tail -f chats.log}
The starship transitions into another sector.
The starship transitions into another sector.

l lily
Lily Kaise
She appears to be 27 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average breasts. Her
face is oval and pretty, with a delicate nose and understated chin. Her lips are
lovely and blush pink and occasionally part to reveal a set of pretty teeth.
Beneath a set of arched eyebrows, her eyes are blue-green and almond-shaped. Her
mid-back length, straight hair is pale honey blonde and swept up into a thick
fall of loose curls down her back. She has oval pink fingernails.
A small enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe and a small
enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.
 She is wearing a pink synthcotton shipsuit with a flaming star printed on the
collar and a pair of sparkly white leather clogs. She is also wearing an orange
and white blessed prayer bracelet around her wrist, a slender bracelet of tiny
tinkling silver bells around her wrist, a neon purple wrist-mounted chronometer,
a solid silver ring engraved with dragonflies, a delicate ring of silver wire
and small purple amethyst crystals, a metallic gold touch einrophone in a
metallic purple reinforced plastic phone holster, and a soft fuchsia Tardick
lizard snuggly labeled 'Asteria'. Her head, face, both eyes, both wrists, and
both hands are left uncovered.
She is carrying a cup of hot French vanilla coffee in her right hand.

#help zap
Command: #zap {[session]}

         Kill your current session.  If there is no current session, it will
         cause the program to terminate. If you provide an argument it'll zap
         the given session instead.

#help textin
Command: #textin {filename} {delay}

         Textin allows the user to read in a file, and send its contents
         directly to the mud.  Useful for doing online creation, or message
         writing. The delay has a micro second precision and is cumulatively
         applied to each outgoing line.

(20 seconds roundtime.)
[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room] (inside a battlesuit)
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a small white trash bin, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a shiny round deep sapphire blue table with a
painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple trees, a greater minimodule of
minidrones boost, Kiska the humanoid service robot, an insulated red cooler, a
compact red refrigerator, a red plastic food storage container, a blue plastic
food storage container, an insulated green cooler, a clear plastic food storage
container, and a Tardick lizard named Asteria here.
You can go up and out.
Lily Kaise (League Paladin) returns from deep space.
exit
You tongue a control inside your battlesuit, which immediately splits down the
front. You carefully climb out.
[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room]
You see a small white trash bin, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a shiny round deep sapphire blue table with a
painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple trees, a greater minimodule of
minidrones boost, Kiska the humanoid service robot, an insulated red cooler, a
compact red refrigerator, a red plastic food storage container, a blue plastic
food storage container, an insulated green cooler, a clear plastic food storage
container, a Tardick lizard named Asteria, an AEU Combat Universalist, and Lily
Kaise (League Paladin) here.

A wormhole suddenly appears in front of the ship, its edges tinged an unusual
deep purple. Strange undulating shapes are half-visible deep inside it.
A thick undulating mist suddenly seems to rush toward the starship from every
direction, quickly blotting out the stars. Random shapes, some half-familiar,
occasionally form in the mist only to disappear almost immediately.
The starship has left a unique area of space.

forward into a bright wormhole in front of the ship. The wormhole blinks out of
existence, and the ship is suddenly in normal space.
The computer announces, "Autotravel destination reached."

A pair of odd-colored stars, one green and one blue, mark this curious area of
space. The sensors are picking up odd bits of noise that the ship's computer
insists on trying to convert to audio. Once in a while, something that could
almost sound like a word emerges from a burst of static.
The computer reports that in-sector beacons are transmitting the following:
R`px[t6MHmGK(Vp0MMZJ="xy|WZRz@ri&t$@xhaC
This area of space is within the green belt of the nearest star, but there are
no life-bearing planets here. Instead there is merely an odd cluster of space
stations of unknown origin.
The sensor noise is much worse here, with a constant dark, gutteral snarling
sound emanating from the ship's speakers. It almost sounds like a language, but
it's nothing you've ever heard before, and the ship's computer cannot pinpoint a
source.

l
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a glossy purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized
bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow and violet aquatic life and
coral rocks, a small yellow ball containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a
small white trash bin, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, Purr
the humanoid service robot, Magellan the arachnoid security robot, Kiska the
humanoid service robot, and Sassie the large fuchsia felo here.
Lily Kaise is standing here.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white
and sapphire star quilt on it.)

almost sound like a word emerges from a burst of static.

l
[Teslatown; Spaceport Airlock]
This airlock leads between the spaceport and the rest of Teslatown. Those who
are not properly equipped with a battlesuit or other suitable heavy-duty
environmental equipment will not proceed past this point. Unless, of course,
they wish to live the rest of their lives in tremendous pain and discomfort,
which may not be so bad because it would be measured in seconds.
You can go north and west.
n
You press a button on an AEU Combat Universalist, which splits open down the
front. You carefully climb inside.
[Teslatown; Finial Avenue] (inside a battlesuit)
Finial Avenue is a length of rather scorched concrete lined by the series of
tall lightning rods that gives it its name. An arching metal lattice overhead
and to either side forms a Faraday cage that keeps out electrical energy.
Scientists and technicians walk up and down the street, wearing environmental
suits which also act as Faraday cages in addition to possessing bulky cooling
units. Among these people occasionally stride even larger figures: people in
powered armor, their suits designed both for environmental protection and
intense ground combat.
You can go north and south.

[Teslatown; Faraday Plaza] (inside a battlesuit)
Faraday Plaza is so named for the immense spherical Faraday cage that stretches
over its entirety, by far the largest such construct on the planet. The massive
cage encloses Teleforce Tom's Lounge and Pub as well as the Electrostatic
Exchange.

l
[Starship "Fearless"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a discount beacon launcher, and Kiska
the humanoid service robot here.
You can go up and out.

take work

l
[Starship "Davion James"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see Kiska the humanoid service robot here.
You can go south and out.
out

Kiska the humanoid service robot clomps in after you.

control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,

charged.

You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a glossy purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized
bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow and violet aquatic life and
coral rocks, a small yellow ball containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a
small white trash bin, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, Purr
the humanoid service robot, Magellan the arachnoid security robot, and Jewel the
large violet glowing felo here.

Subject: Re: About org ships, your opinions needed
Author: Morris Corlew
Posted: 18:44 11 July 2316 GST
--
Hi, Kim. First, I would love the ability to rent a medium transport at 350. I
think I can't buy mine til 500, so renting one for salvage ops would be
wonderful.
I don't really have an opinion on the fighters, so will stay away from that one.
We talked recently about the possibility of a rentable roid hauler with
upgrades. I'm sure you know, as I stated at the time, that would make me
tremendously happy.
Morris 'The Moose' Corlew

Kim

Subject: About org ships, your opinions needed
Author: Kim Saunders
Posted: 13:14 11 July 2316 GST
--
Hi Starseekers,
I have been going over the ships we currently have, a total of 23. Most of these
are available for rent in some form or another. Now it's not a problem for
Starseekers to keep these ships, but I would prefer that the ships we have are
something you need. So, any comments or questions about ships are welcome. A few
particular things below.
Currently Starseekers has 2 fighters, a hyperion electronic warfair which is
barely upgraded, and a heavy fighter. We could keep both, or 1, or get rid of
them, we could upgrade them, and we could get a bastille.
then, is anyone looking to rent a light transport? If so, what level of upgrades
do you think it should have.
I think I will give the medium transport a little bit of a downgrade so people
with 350 industry can rent it.
these are my thoughts and questions for now, feel free to express yourselves,
it's what this board is here for!
Kim
--

An AEU Pilot's Guide To Ships And Upgrades                                      
  Page 4
Transports:
Two-Person Light Transport 15,000,000.00 (Old Earth in the city of Cherise)
U-5 UNITED FREIGHT D'INTSEC FIREFLY-CLASS LIGHT TRANSPORT
Class: Transport
Requirements: 30 industry points        0 combat points
Model number: U-5                       Designation: Light Transport
Turret hardpoints: 1                    Launcher hardpoints: 0
Standard storage capacity: 35000        Standard battery hours: 4
Docking bay size required: 77
If you want to finally salvage or trade with something better than your cargo
hauler, then the light transport is the best ship for you in the next line of
upgrades. It's not as well armed as the cargo hauler, but holds a lot more
debris.
Two-Person Medium Transport 375,000,000.00 (Old Earth in the city of Cherise)
U-2 UNITED FREIGHT D'INTSEC SERENDIPITY-CLASS MEDIUM TRANSPORT
Class: Transport
Requirements: 700 industry points       0 combat points
Model number: U-2                       Designation: Medium Transport
Turret hardpoints: 2                    Launcher hardpoints: 0
Standard storage capacity: 60000        Standard battery hours: 6
Docking bay size required: 96
The Medium Transport is currently the best ship that an AEU pilot can get for
salvaging and trading. This will show even more when a pilot can upgrade its
cargo hold to the highest storage extender.
put upgrades in briefcase
You put a copy of "An AEU Pilot's Guide To Ships And Upgrades" in a leather
briefcase.
use phone
Your number: 0010-18113

Subject: About org ships, your opinions needed
Author: Kim Saunders
Posted: 13:14 11 July 2316 GST
--
Hi Starseekers,
I have been going over the ships we currently have, a total of 23. Most of these
are available for rent in some form or another. Now it's not a problem for
Starseekers to keep these ships, but I would prefer that the ships we have are
something you need. So, any comments or questions about ships are welcome. A few
particular things below.
Currently Starseekers has 2 fighters, a hyperion electronic warfair which is
barely upgraded, and a heavy fighter. We could keep both, or 1, or get rid of
them, we could upgrade them, and we could get a bastille.
then, is anyone looking to rent a light transport? If so, what level of upgrades
do you think it should have.
I think I will give the medium transport a little bit of a downgrade so people
with 350 industry can rent it.
these are my thoughts and questions for now, feel free to express yourselves,
it's what this board is here for!
Kim
--

Enter your selection:
4
Enter the body of your post.
[Type lines of input; use `.' to end or `@abort' to abort the command.]
Jewel the large violet glowing felo wanders in from the south.
Hi Everyone,
I think we should get rid of one of the fighters. The electronic warfare fighter
is barely functional. I used it to do a standard beacon and I swear I grew 100
years older before I completed it. Ok, a bit of an exaggeration, but the point
is that it took forever! So, I vote we get rid of it, keep the heavy fighter and
buy a bastille. I'd be happy to outfit the bastille if we decide to purchase
one.
In terms of the light transport, it only requires 30 industry and 15 mill to
purchase. This is pretty easily obtainable for even newer pilots. If we
downgrade the medium transport so that it can be rented with 350 industry, I
think it'll serve most of the org members except the really newer pilots. In
short, I don't really see a point in having a light transport. Just my thoughts.
*
*
*
Shule
*
.
--
Subject: Re: About org ships, your opinions needed
--
Hi Everyone,
I think we should get rid of one of the fighters. The electronic warfare fighter
is barely functional. I used it to do a standard beacon and I swear I grew 100
years older before I completed it. Ok, a bit of an exaggeration, but the point
is that it took forever! So, I vote we get rid of it, keep the heavy fighter and
buy a bastille. I'd be happy to outfit the bastille if we decide to purchase
one.
In terms of the light transport, it only requires 30 industry and 15 mill to
purchase. This is pretty easily obtainable for even newer pilots. If we
downgrade the medium transport so that it can be rented with 350 industry, I
think it'll serve most of the org members except the really newer pilots. In
short, I don't really see a point in having a light transport. Just my thoughts.
Shule
--
Do you wish to make this post?
[Enter `yes' or `no']

Logged out of FTL Message Board Net.
l
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a glossy purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized
bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow and violet aquatic life and
coral rocks, a small yellow ball containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a
small white trash bin, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, Purr
the humanoid service robot, Magellan the arachnoid security robot, Kiska the
humanoid service robot, and Jewel the large violet glowing felo here.
You can go south and out.
A long gold soft-bodied creature with many claw-tipped tentacles rears up
suddenly from behind a plastic wrecked EAOS Defender and wraps its tentacles
around it as if trying to drag it into the deep.
[Notification from Starseekers] A load of salvage has been received at League
Unmanned Pickup Debris-Burning Temporary Station from the two-person medium
transport "Money Maker". The organization has earned 1,276,856.32 credits.
take work
You remove Shule Elemmire's workbench from a leather briefcase.
put work in briefcase
You put Shule Elemmire's workbench in a leather briefcase.
out
[Starship "William Dove"; Airlock]
You see a large secure xenology storage container, a row of flightlockers, a rug
woven of large dark green fern fronds, and a glossy seashell pink ceramic felo
chow bowl here.

appliqued on the front, a pair of slim blue stone linen trousers, and a pair of

briefs and a pair of black socks. You are also wearing a keychain, a metallic
gold touch einrophone in a black leather phone holster, a gold wrist-mounted
chronometer, a metallic silver metachannel FTL communicator, a solid silver ring
engraved with dolphins, a black guitar case, and a backpack. You are concealing
a leather briefcase, a golden Feng Wo coin purse, a black flightbag with a red
shooting star on the side, a camera bag, an asteroid hauling supply kit, a
flight control scanner, a large expandable telescoping xenology container, a
black engineering tool case, a thick synthleather bandolier with large pockets,
and a scorched metal thigh holster. Your head, face, both eyes, neck, both
wrists, and both hands are left uncovered.
You are carrying nothing.
l
[Manhattan Spaceport; Pilot Lounge]
Seemingly wedged in the extra space between two other rooms, this lounge is very
narrow but extends far back, giving it enough room to seat quite a few people.
The light from the suspended lamps is warm and easy on the eyes, casting
everything in a rich golden glow, and the booths are padded and comfortable. The
walls are decorated with countless replicas of old flags and yellowing paper
maps of Earth's various countries. A tiny holovid nestled at the far edge of
each booth shows both a view of the landing pad outside and the latest news
broadcasts. There is a stairway at the back of the room that leads to the
garage.
You see a lacquered wooden bar, a public holovid, a small red trash can, a
brightly-lit candy vending machine, and a salt lick here.

nearest holovid, where the image of a ship can be seen landing on the outside
landing pad. An informative bit of text below it identifies it as the two-person
medium transport "Money Maker".

here.

the ship enters normal status.

[Manhattan Spaceport; Pilot Lounge]
Seemingly wedged in the extra space between two other rooms, this lounge is very
narrow but extends far back, giving it enough room to seat quite a few people.
The light from the suspended lamps is warm and easy on the eyes, casting
everything in a rich golden glow, and the booths are padded and comfortable. The
walls are decorated with countless replicas of old flags and yellowing paper
maps of Earth's various countries. A tiny holovid nestled at the far edge of
each booth shows both a view of the landing pad outside and the latest news
broadcasts. There is a stairway at the back of the room that leads to the
garage.
You see a lacquered wooden bar, a public holovid, a small red trash can, a
brightly-lit candy vending machine, a salt lick, and Zim the security hoverbot
here.
Lily Kaise and Eugene Silverlance are standing here.

[Old Earth; Manhattan Spaceport]
Welcome to Manhattan Spaceport! The entire place seems brand new, the glass
sparkling, the plasteel gleaming. Starships arrive and depart while others sit
on individual pads, rings of lights blinking around them as they are recharged.
Occasionally, the ground vibrates and the low rumble of heavy hydraulics is
heard as a starship is brought up from the underground garage or lowered for
extended parking below. Around the huge landing pad, wide, arched doorways
framed in brushed steel lead to various station services: Repair & Rearm to the
northeast, Supply to the southeast, Station Security to the southwest, and the
Mail Room to the northwest. In addition, a classy lighted sign over one doorway
reads, 'Pilot Lounge.' You can GO into it. There is also a doorway marked
'Liaison Office' that you can also GO into. Over the corridor to the south,
another sign reads 'Spaceport Exit and Express Train.'
There appear to be some people in the lounge.
The three-person light gunboat "Exsanguination" and the two-person medium
transport "Symphonic Deluge" are landed here.
You see an asteroid-shaped steel trash bin here.
You can go north, northeast, east, southeast, south, southwest, west, northwest,
and down.

l
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a glossy purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized
bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow and violet aquatic life and
coral rocks, a small yellow ball containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a
small white trash bin, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, Purr
the humanoid service robot, Magellan the arachnoid security robot, and Kiska the
humanoid service robot here.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white
and sapphire star quilt on it.)

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a glossy purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized
bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow and violet aquatic life and
coral rocks, a small yellow ball containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a
small white trash bin, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, Purr
the humanoid service robot, Magellan the arachnoid security robot, and Kiska the
humanoid service robot here.
You can go south and out.
sit couch
You sit down on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it.
l
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a glossy purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized
bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow and violet aquatic life and
coral rocks, a small yellow ball containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a
small white trash bin, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, Purr
the humanoid service robot, Magellan the arachnoid security robot, and Kiska the
humanoid service robot here.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white
and sapphire star quilt on it.)

You peer up...
[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The busy landing pad of New Earth's capital city's spaceport sits over a large
bay at the tip of the southern continent. The pad itself is a huge square sheet
of white plasteel surrounded by gleaming new starship service structures. On the
southern side of the pad is a circular structure with wide transparisteel
windows affording a fabulous view of the ocean. A softly lit sign over the
transparisteel doorway reads, 'Pilot Lounge,' and a separate doorway is marked
'Liaison Office.' It looks like you can GO into either of those places. To the
west, a bridge spans the gap between the landing pad and the rest of the
spaceport.
The scout "AEU Navy Honour Guard Scout Upsilon-6" and the scout "AEU Navy Honour
Guard Scout Mu-6" are landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine and a small trash can here.
You can go north, south, west, and down.

Among the AEU, you have not very many starship combat points, not very many
aggregate points, not very many exploration points, not very many industry
points, and relatively few ground combat points.
Related to industry, you are good with asteroid hauls, inexperienced with
Teslatown activities, very inexperienced with deliveries, very inexperienced
with salvages, very inexperienced with belt management, very inexperienced with
passengers, very inexperienced with asteroid mining, very inexperienced with
atmospheric scooping, very inexperienced with salvage operations, and very
inexperienced with trading.
Related to starship combat, you are very good at combat gunning, inexperienced
with mission-related ship kills, inexperienced at combat piloting, very
inexperienced at advanced engineering techniques, very inexperienced with minor
skirmish ship kills, very inexperienced at defending salvage operations, and
very inexperienced with invading ship kills.
Related to ground combat, you are inexperienced with weapon hits, very
inexperienced with kills, and very inexperienced with ground missions.
Related to exploration, you are inexperienced with local artifact finds,
inexperienced with alien artifact finds, very inexperienced at the exploration
of the Glyphmaker ruins, very inexperienced with planetary finds, very
inexperienced with space imaging, and very inexperienced with assisted planetary
finds.

[The Torus; Torus Restaurant]
The glory of the endless expanse of starry space is revealed here through the
transparent dome over this small but elegant restaurant. A spiral staircase in
the center of the restaurant leads down to the main level of the station, and
luxurious black carpeting covers the floor, extending outward to a long
silver-trimmed black plasteel bar encircling the room. Cushioned black leather
bar stools are arranged along the bar, and on the other side is a black plasteel
waiter droid which moves with quiet efficiency to fill customers' orders. A
two-meter-high wall of shiny black plasteel around the outside of the bar
contains notices and a few other photographs and mementos. You see a framed
photo of several pilots gleefully kicking a downed Outsider, a large glossy
framed photo of Benjamin Masterson, a large glossy photo of a beautiful green
planet in space, a small photograph of a pile of burning money, and a large
glossy AFW promotional poster hanging on various walls.

Subject: New Time Slot Addition for The Torus Hyperwave
Author: Lily Kaise
Posted: 01:06 18 July 2316 GST
--
Hello Pilots, I have reserved the time slot of 1500 to 15:59 GST for The Torus
Hyperwave on behalf of SEAS. I will maintain this slot for as long as it is
viable. You do not need to be a member of SEAS to utilize it. However, I please
ask that you use it for responsible Exploration related communications.
--
[1] Previous
[2] Return
[3] Reply
[4] Quit
--

i
 You are wearing a long-sleeved dark blue tee with a large white lightning bolt
appliqued on the front, a pair of slim blue stone linen trousers, and a pair of
gray canvas sneakers. Underneath this, you are wearing a pair of white cotton
briefs and a pair of black socks. You are also wearing a keychain, a metallic
gold touch einrophone in a black leather phone holster, a gold wrist-mounted
chronometer, a metallic silver metachannel FTL communicator, a solid silver ring
engraved with dolphins, a black guitar case, and a backpack. You are concealing
a leather briefcase, a golden Feng Wo coin purse, a black flightbag with a red
shooting star on the side, a camera bag, an asteroid hauling supply kit, a
flight control scanner, a large expandable telescoping xenology container, a
black engineering tool case, a thick synthleather bandolier with large pockets,
and a scorched metal thigh holster. Your head, face, both eyes, neck, both
wrists, and both hands are left uncovered.
You are carrying an insulated red cooler in your right hand, and a clear plastic
food storage container in your left hand.
Lily Kaise smiles at you.
put red in briefcase
You put an insulated red cooler in a leather briefcase.
put clear in briefcase
You put a clear plastic food storage container in a leather briefcase.

 You are wearing a long-sleeved dark blue tee with a large white lightning bolt
appliqued on the front, a pair of slim blue stone linen trousers, and a pair of
gray canvas sneakers. Underneath this, you are wearing a pair of white cotton
briefs and a pair of black socks. You are also wearing a keychain, a metallic

chronometer, a metallic silver metachannel FTL communicator, a solid silver ring
engraved with dolphins, a black guitar case, and a backpack. You are concealing

shooting star on the side, a camera bag, an asteroid hauling supply kit, a
flight control scanner, a large expandable telescoping xenology container, a
black engineering tool case, a thick synthleather bandolier with large pockets,
and a scorched metal thigh holster. Your head, face, both eyes, neck, both
wrists, and both hands are left uncovered.

with spicy rice pilaf and grilled whole green beans on the side beautifully
arranged on a white china plate in your right hand, and a crystal goblet of
